ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Perform common useful JavaScript operations in Shiny apps that will greatly improve your apps without having to know any JavaScript. Examples include: hiding an element, disabling an input, resetting an input back to its original value, delaying code execution by a few seconds, and many more useful functions for both the end user and the developer. 'shinyjs' can also be used to easily call your own custom JavaScript functions from R.

Perform common useful JavaScript operations in Shiny apps that will greatly improve your apps without having to know any JavaScript. Examples include: hiding an element, disabling an input, resetting an input back to its original value, delaying code execution by a few seconds, and many more useful functions for both the end user and the developer. 'shinyjs' can also be used to easily call your own custom JavaScript functions from R.

name: r-shinyjs
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.1.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-shinyjs
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: shinyjs_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/shinyjs_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/shinyjs/shinyjs_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8f0b12f7434275d014599470f0dbf0ebd7fb65e8bd3c0ba75d0e207bd3051eff

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-digest >=0.6.8
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-shiny >=1.0.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-digest >=0.6.8
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-shiny >=1.0.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('shinyjs')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('shinyjs')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://deanattali.com/shinyjs
  license: MIT
  summary: "Perform common useful JavaScript operations in Shiny apps that will greatly improve your apps without having to know any JavaScript. Examples include: hiding an element, disabling an input, resetting an input back to its original value, delaying code execution by a few seconds, and many more useful functions
    for both the end user and the developer. 'shinyjs' can also be used to easily call your own custom JavaScript functions from R."
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
